intro: Ecbolium subcordatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ecbolium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
